questions.question: What is the purpose of the <meta charset="UTF-8"> tag in an HTML document?
options: To define the layout of the webpage
To specify the character encoding used in the document
To load fonts from external sources
questions.answer: To specify the character encoding used in the document

questions.question: Which tag is used to group block-level elements in HTML?
What is the correct way to make a numbered list in HTML?
You want to create a form that allows users to upload a file. Which input type should you use?
A developer wants to display an image that links to another page when clicked. Which combination of tags should they use?
You need to add a tooltip to a piece of text that shows more information on hover. Which HTML attribute should be used?
What is the purpose of the <!DOCTYPE html> declaration in an HTML document?
options: To define the CSS version used
To inform the browser of the HTML version used
To start the HTML comment section
questions.answer: To inform the browser of the HTML version used

questions.question: Which tag is used to define an independent piece of content in HTML5?
Which attribute is required in an tag for accessibility?
What is the main difference between <section> and <div>?
options: <section> adds structure and meaning, <div> does not
Both are used interchangeably for text formatting
questions.answer: <section> adds structure and meaning, <div> does not

questions.question: What does the defer attribute do in the <script> tag?
options: Delays script execution until after the HTML is parsed
questions.answer: Delays script execution until after the HTML is parsed

questions.question: What is the correct use of the <meta> tag for character encoding in HTML5?
You want to group related navigation links together in a semantic way. Which tag should you use?
You’re creating a form and want to ensure the user doesn't leave the "email" field blank. Which attribute should you use?
You’re embedding a YouTube video into your site. Which tag should you use?
You have a large table of data and want to provide a heading that repeats on each printed page. Which tag should you use?
You want to link to a downloadable PDF file. Which attribute ensures the file is downloaded instead of opened in the browser?
You're designing a layout and want to mark the content for the sidebar. Which HTML5 element is most appropriate?
Which HTML attribute is used to ensure that a script runs asynchronously with the HTML parsing process?
Which HTML element is designed to represent machine-readable data, such as dates, times, or durations?
What does the contenteditable attribute do in HTML?
options: Allows content to be styled with CSS
Makes the element's content editable by the user
Prevents user interaction with an element
questions.answer: Makes the element's content editable by the user

questions.question: Why would you use the hidden attribute in an HTML element?
options: To display an element only on mobile
To completely hide the element from rendering and accessibility tools
To remove the element from the DOM
questions.answer: To completely hide the element from rendering and accessibility tools

questions.question: What is the difference between <b> and <strong> in HTML5?
options: <b> is used for bold text with semantic meaning

questions.question: You are designing a form that includes credit card input. Which HTML5 input type is most appropriate?
You want to include a fallback message for a <video> tag that may not be supported in some browsers. Where should you put the message?
You’re creating an FAQ page where each question expands/collapses on click. Which HTML element should be used for semantic structure?
You want a text input to be pre-filled with the user's name after authentication. Which attribute is best for this?
You are building a multilingual site. Which tag helps specify the language of part of your content?
You’re building a complex SVG-based graphic inline within HTML. What tag should wrap it to make it accessible and semantic?
What attribute should be used on an <a> tag to open the linked page in a new browser tab while ensuring security best practices?
